Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert choreographer specializing in folk dances. I will ask some questions to collect information, and then I will use the information to create a dance routine.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write an explicit step-by-step dancing routine for people to follow using the questions and answers above.

QApair.What kind of folk dance would you like t: I would like to learn a folk dance.

QApair.Do you have any specific moves in mind?: I would like to learn folk dancing

QApair.What is the occasion for which you would: I would like to explore folk culture

QApair.When do you need the dance routine?: I need the dance routine now.

QApair.Where will the dance be performed?: The dance will be performed in front of an audience in a park.

QApair.What is the skill level of the dancers?: Most people are beginners, some are intermediate

Instances.Output: 1. Get into groups of 4  2. Start with your left foot, and step to the side then bring your right foot to meet your left 3. Step to the side with your left foot again, and then bring your right foot to meet your left  4. Step to the side with your right foot, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 5. Step to the side with your right foot again, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 6. Step to the side with your left foot, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 7. Step to the side with your left foot again, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 8. Step to the side with your right foot, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 9. Step to the side with your right foot again, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 10. Step to the side with your left foot, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 11. Step to the side with your left foot again, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 12. Step to the side with your right foot, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 13. Step to the side with your right foot again, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 14. Step to the side with your left foot, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 15. Step to the side with your left foot again, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 16. Step to the side with your right foot, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 17. Step to the side with your right foot again, and then bring your left foot to meet your right 18. Step to the side with your left foot, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 19. Step to the side with your left foot again, and then bring your right foot to meet your left 20. Step to the side with your right foot, and then bring your left foot to meet your right

QApair.What kind of folk dance would you like t: I would like to learn elements of a  folk dance.

QApair.What is your favorite music genre?: I like folk music, but open to other as well.

QApair.How many people will be dancing?: There will be one hundred people dancing.

QApair.Do you have any specific moves in mind?: I would like to learn folk dancing moves.

QApair.What is the occasion for which you would: I would like to explore the folk culture and share it with people

QApair.Where will the dance be performed?: The dance will be performed in an open space outside.

Instances.Output: Intro:  People will start in a circle, holding hands.  Step 1:  On the count of three, everyone will take a step to the right, while still holding hands.  Step 2:  On the next count of three, everyone will take a step to the left.  Step 3:  On the following count of three, everyone will raise their left hand in the air and step forward with their right foot.  Step 4:  On the next count of three, everyone will raise their right hand in the air and step forward with their left foot.  Step 5:  On the following count of three, everyone will clap their hands three times.  Step 6:  On the next count of three, everyone will stamp their feet three times.  Step 7:  On the following count of three, everyone will turn to the person on their right and bow.  Step 8:  On the next count of three, everyone will turn to the person on their left and curtsy.  Step 9:  On the following count of three, everyone will jump in the air and click their heels together three times.  Ending:  On the next count of three, everyone will take a bow.

QApair.What kind of folk dance would you like t: I would like to learn the elements of Irish folk dance

QApair.How many people will be dancing?: There will be one 10 people dancing.

QApair.Do you have any specific moves in mind?: I would like to learn Irish folk dancing moves.

QApair.What is the occasion for which you would: I would like to explore the Irish folk culture and and connect with people

QApair.Where will the dance be performed?: The dance will be performed inside a cultural center

Instances.Output: 1-10 people line up in a straight line, men and women alternating  2-The first person in line begins by tapping their right foot three times on the ground  3-While still tapping their right foot, they raise their left arm in the air  4-On the fourth tap, they bring their left arm down and stomp their left foot  5-The second person in line repeats steps 2-5  6-The third person in line repeats steps 2-5  7-The fourth person in line repeats steps 2-5  8-The fifth person in line repeats steps 2-5  9-The sixth person in line repeats steps 2-5  10-The seventh person in line repeats steps 2-5  11-The eighth person in line repeats steps 2-5  12-The ninth person in line repeats steps 2-5  13-The tenth person in line repeats steps 2-5  14-The first person in line begins again by tapping their right foot three times on the ground  15-While still tapping their right foot, they raise their left arm in the air  16-On the fourth tap, they bring their left arm down and stomp their left foot  17-The second person in line repeats steps 14-17  18-The third person in line repeats steps 14-17  19-The fourth person in line repeats steps 14-17  20-The fifth person in line repeats steps 14-17  21-The sixth person in line repeats steps 14-17  22-The seventh person in line repeats steps 14-17  23-The eighth person in line repeats steps 14-17  24-The ninth person in line repeats steps 14-17  25-The tenth person in line repeats steps 14-17
